verbose_text: The patterns of DNA occupancy and differential expression analyses reveal T-box TF regulatory inputs that define neuromesodermal bipotency and prime mesoderm for further differentiation as follows : (1) stem cell maintenance by autoregulation of Xbra / Xbra3 via fibroblast growth factor (FGF) signaling and regulation of retinoic acid levels by cyp26a1 beyond the tail bud stage; (2) specification of paraxial mesoderm by Tbx6, msgn1, and foxc1; (3) myogenic differentiation by myf5, myoD, myos, and actc1; (4) patterning of presomitic mesoderm by delta2, esr4, esr5, LOC773709 (this study), mespa, mespb, mesp2, ripply2.1, and ripply2.2; and (5) continuous protection from neuralization by repression of neurogenic genes, such as sox3 and pax3.
evidence: expression analyses reveal T-box TF regulatory inputs that define neuromesodermal bipotency and prime mesoderm for further differentiation as follows: (1) stem cell maintenance by autoregulation of Xbra/Xbra3 via fibroblast growth factor (FGF) signaling               and regulation of retinoic acid levels by cyp26a1               beyond the tail bud stage; (2) specification of paraxial mesoderm by Tbx6              , msgn1              , and foxc1              ; (3) myogenic differentiation by myf5, myoD, myos, and actc1; (4) patterning of presomitic mesoderm by delta2              , esr4, esr5              , LOC773709 (this study), mespa, mespb              , mesp2, ripply2.1, and ripply2.2              ; and (5) continuous protection from neuralization by repression of neurogenic genes, such as sox3
